content.text:
# Kathleen Stewart

}}
Kathleen Stewart (born 1958 Sydney) is an Australian writer. She has written eight novels, and published two books of poetry. Her novel Spilt Milk was shortlisted for the NSW Premier's Award, and her memoir The After Life was shortlisted for the Nita Kibble Literary Award. Her novel Men of Bad Character was published by the University of Queensland Press in June, 2010.
Personal life
She currently lives in the Blue Mountains of Australia.
Publications
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=dBUCyw6bF04C&q=Men+of+Bad+Character Men of Bad Character] (2010)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=SsULAQAAMAAJ The After Life: A memoir] (2008)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=PYL_V7QojFAC The Black Butterfly] (2001)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=5Q1CPwAACAAJ The Red Room] (1999)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=_1Q4PQAACAAJ The White Star] (1997)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=jXxJAAAACAAJ Nightflowers] (1996)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=GRghAQAAIAAJ Spilt Milk] (1995)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=1yb7AAAACAAJ Snow] (1994)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=ha6YAAAACAAJ Louis: A Normal Novel] (1993)
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=UJjpAAAACAAJ The Victim Train] (1992)
Awards and nominations
* 2009 - Nita Kibble Literary Award for The After Life: A memoir
* 1995 - NSW Premier's Award for Spilt Milk
* 1994 - Victorian Premier's Literary Award for Snow
